description.narrative: AECF Connect (also referred to as Connect 1.0 in this statement and realted documents) offers services to AECF grantee businesses that are looking to raise capital from impact investors and other related sources. The agreement was signed in December 2012 with a total budget of 16,000,000SEK (all from SIDA), and the activity period ended on 31st March 2019. AECF Connect focuses on three main strategies to help AECF grantee firms access capital from impact investors and others: 1). targeting grant applicants interested in accessing additional finance; 2). supporting grantee fundraising; and, 3). developing the fundraising market. Connect has provided a range of other services in addition to supporting grantee fundraising. The Agreement has been amended with non-cost extensions 5 times, since the Agreement was first signed in December 2012. The last and final amendment extended the activity period until 31st of March 2019. From inception to date, Connect has set out to achieve the following objectives (aggregated from the original agreement and project proposal together with subsequent amendments). It is worth noting that the Connect 1.0 which was a pilot phase that was suppose to end 30th September 2016, was designed with a very limited logframe, with key performance indicators being gradually added through several amendments of the original agreement. The main objectives with Connect 1.0, whose performance will be assessed in this completion memo, were the following: 1. Support 14 companies in raising $25m from third party investors and lenders2. Provide fundraising capacity building for 120 companies 3. Connect portfolio companies reach 100,000 households4. Design a follow on phase (Connect 2.0)5. Mobilize funding for Connect 2.06. Carry out an external evaluation of the program
Creation of a financial brokage function at AECF for more leverage of private financing of agribusinesses within the AECF portfolio.
Skapa en finansiell enhet som ska underlätta ökad finansering till jordbruksrelaterade företag i Afrika inom AECF portföljen.

description.narrative: Connect 1.0 supported twelve companies, in seven countries (Ethiopia, Kenya, Rwanda, Tanzania, Uganda, Zambia and Zimbabwe) to raise US$ 44.9m through 18 transactions with third party investors and lenders. This was against an initial target to support 14 companies in raising $25m, within the same period. The twelve companies delivered an outsized development impact (improved incomes and wages) of US$350 million during the program period and reached over 700,000 households annually. Agflow, a poultry farm in Ethiopia, contributed over 25% of the cumulative AECF Connect 1.0 Development Impact, reported by AECF as at the end of 2018. An external evaluation of Connect conducted by Dalberg from July-September 2018 established that the Connect 1.0 demonstrated a successful “proof of concept” and recommended a follow-on phase that would expand the scope of the program beyond capital raising to include supporting enterprises in becoming investment ready. Going forward, providing investment readiness support to companies will be an important catalyzer in the success of the capital raising process. The evaluation report is uploaded in TRAC and assessed separately, see statement on evaluation. The strategy for a follow-on phase “Connect 2.0” has been developed and outlines the proposed approach, the intended results and resources required to roll out Connect 2.0 interventions for the five-year period (2019 – 2023). The strategy document for Connect 2.0 was a result as per one of the amendments, for AECF to be able to plan for the future and for Sida to exit its support in a sustainable manner. Embassy of Sweden in Nairobi has not assessed the Connect 2.0 strategy document as part of this statement on report, as the next phase Connect 2.0 is not part of the Connect 1.0 program.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
